[KOGITO-2766] Refactoring initialization code

Generated handlers are now passed to constructor explicitly (handlers
fields is
removed), which registers them, both for injection and non injection
paths (which means that when injection is not used, caller of the
constructor will explicitly have to pass it)

Configure and registerListeners methods are only generated if they have
content (if there are listeners)

If injection is not used, activate method will be invoked from
constructor. If it is active, then it is invoked using quarkus start
event or springboot post construct as it is now.

timeline.bodyText:
As far as I can see this concept only exists in Spring and not in CDI (even if quarkus impl should be lazy by default).
Why do you need it?
Minor note, can you add a javadoc?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
As you correctly detect, for SpringBoot we need to add lazy annotation to handlers passed as parameters in the constructor.
SpringBoot has issues with circular dependencies when using construction injection. If, as happens in one of the examples, one of the beans injected into the handler, depends on the Process, SpringBoot wont start unless we include lazy annotation (this issue does not appear in Quarkus)
I use a descriptive name, but we can use a more abstract one for the new method something as constructorParam. wdyt?
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: After thinking a while, I think for consistency with the existing interface, the word lazy needs to be there
replies.author: fjtirado
danielezonca

replies.bodyText: I think constructor injection is what this JIRA was all about (this allow us to remove fields and remove separate initialization). I do not see a big trouble with lazy if used where it should be (just the constructor parameters). Also, please notice this is a workaround for SpringBoot, Quakus resolve circular dependencies without any issue.
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText:
What Im trying to say is that annotating something with Lazy is not an issue at all (a proxy is created and intialized the first time is used, pretty similar what field injection actually does). Which is an issue is to use construction injection on springboot without the lazy. If we use construction injection somewhere else, we need to have this into account (and the annotator will be ready).
Does it make sense to use constructor injection in this particular scenario? I think the answer is yes, so I vote going for it
replies.author: fjtirado
evacchi

replies.bodyText:
Let me try to reply

Place where the annotator is used are now minimized (grouped as far as possible) in codegen
As you said, this point should be a different JIRA which change the approach we are using to insert annotations and use two different templates rather than annotator (I confess Im not a fan of the template approach and do not see the advantage of having 2 templated compared with having 2 annotator implementation. I feel  we are going to duplicate a lot of code in the templates as already happen with resources, but this is part of that another JIRA discussion ;))
Since we are using a generator, I think is better to restrict the handler to the ones that really makes sense for a particular process, thats why Im using concrete handlers rather than a generic list, so it is guaranteed that only those handlers that are part of the process definition are registered. This was my humble aportation to the JIRA description and I think is an improvement that Im really reluctant to remove.
Also please note that first parameter of registerhandler method  is not really equal to class cannonical name
Name is org.acme.travels.services.GreetingTravellerService_greetTraveller_3_Handler
Class name is org.kie.kogito.handlers.GreetingTravellerService_greetTraveller_3_Handler

The code I would generate (following your proposal)  is (using handler.getName(), not canonical name, to register the handler in AbstractProcess)
    @javax.inject.Inject()
    public TravellersProcess(org.kie.kogito.app.Application app, org.kie.kogito.handlers.GreetingTravellerService_greetTraveller_3_Handler greetingTravellerService_greetTraveller_3_Handler, org.kie.kogito.handlers.TravellerAuditService_auditTraveller_7_Handler travellerAuditService_auditTraveller_7_Handler, org.kie.kogito.handlers.StoreTravellerService_storeTraveller_2_Handler storeTravellerService_storeTraveller_2_Handler) {
        super(app.config().process(), Arrays.asList(greetingTravellerService_greetTraveller_3_Handler,travellerAuditService_auditTraveller_7_Handler,storeTravellerService_storeTraveller_2_Handler));
}

3a) BTW, do we need app to be a field at all?
4) Circular dependency happens here https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-examples/blob/stable/process-optaplanner-quarkus/src/main/java/org/kie/kogito/examples/service/FlightSeatingSolveService.java. This is a service injected by the handler that is injecting the process. Since there is not way to prevent that circular depedency, lazy is the solution for spring boot.
5) I applied a fine grane approach, only annotate with lazy what really needs to be annotated (please note that currently Application bean is not annotated with lazy because we know for sure that there is not circular dependency here), but of course we can switch to coarse approach and lazy initialize all constructor parameters

ok let's file a jira for that
we are using the Collection approach for ApplicationConfig and ProcessConfig. In this case, I'd rather uniform the codebase with that approach; otherwise we would have to modify ProcessConfig et al. for consistency.


Also please note that first parameter of registerhandler method is not really equal to class cannonical name

I'd argue we should make lazy the Process field of that service in the example instead, wdyt ? :)

If getPackageDeclaration() returns an empty Optional this will produce an invalid string: .ClassName
Can you please verify if getPackageDeclaration() can be empty (i.e. default package)?
If not I think it is better to throw an exception like "This should never happen" instead of a empty string.
In general we can probably replace the code with this alternative

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                            listener.getPackageDeclaration().map(pd -> pd.getName().toString()).orElse("") + "." +clazz.getName()),
          
          
            
                                            listener.getPackageDeclaration().map(pd -> pd.getName().toString() + "." + clazz.getName()).orElse(clazz.getName()),
          
      
    
    
  

Wdyt?
